metadata.dc:author: Díaz de la Llera, L S
Fernández Fernández, J
Wilhelmi Ayza, M
Selva Bellod, E
Rey Naya, J
García de la Llana, M A
metadata.dc:description: A nineteen-year-old male was diagnosed as having a foreign body in his cardiac muscle after a mild open thoracic injury. Diagnosis and follow-up was performed by two-dimensional echocardiography. He did not show any complications after a 6 month follow-up. We emphasize the rare presentation of this entity and the usefulness of echocardiography to attain the foreign body's size and place. Also, echocardiography helps therapeutic management and diagnosis of complications.
metadata.dc:title: Diagnóstico topográfico mediante ecocardiografía bidimensional de un cuerpo extraño intramiocárdico.
[Topographic diagnosis by two-dimensional echocardiography of an intramyocardial foreign body].
